revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Anker |model=Uspeed Dual Band Router 300Mbps |revision= |upc=848061081053 |ean= |asin=B008AE2WV8 |price= |est_release_date=8/2012 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=China |manuf=Winstars |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id= |ic_id= |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand= |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand= |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols= |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid=Wireless,Wireless(5G) |default_ssid_regex=^Wireless$,,,^Wireless(5G)$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=00:23:13 |oui_eth=00:23:13 }} [http://www.ianker.com/Anker-wireless-router-dual-band-5ghz/product/66UPDBWR-BU Product page]
This is clearly a '''Winstars''' device. The appearance is extremely similar to the [[Monoprice 8070]].
I would presume that this device uses a motley of '''Realtek''' chips. It may use a dual-MAC '''Realtek''' dual-band wireless chip. :Running in simultaneous dual-band mode limits both bands to single-stream mode (max 150Mbps) only.
As the SSIDs of '''Wireless(2.4G)''' and '''Wireless(5G)''' show up in multiple customer videos, they are presumed to be the default SSIDs. The SSID appears to be one singular setting, the same SSID will be used for both bands (with '''(2.4G)''' and '''(5G)''' automatically appended).
[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cibxRb91jIk USpeed Dual-Band 2.4GHz & 5GHz Wireless Broadband Router] (video linked from vendor's product page) :00:23:13 OUI
